image.altText: black and white graphic showing old newspaper articles saying slacks banned

props.synopsis: When Dorothy Henderson-Smart based her decision to wear trousers on convenience, little did she know she'd end up making headlines. Years later, her family has uncovered the story of the "girl who shocked Canberra".

title.children: 'The girl who shocked Canberra': Dorothy Henderson-Smart and the fashion choice that sparked a national outcry

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: The 27-year-old man has been jailed for a dramatic attack and robbery with two others, after the victim recognised him because they'd been to school together.

title.children: Canberra man jailed for over two years for 'cowardly' unprovoked robbery

image.altText: Three men stand with their arms around one another, all smiling.

props.synopsis: Victor Croker and Dave Leemhuis struggled to keep their bees alive during winter so they developed a new insulated hive. It's proved so popular among beekeepers that 500 are now being shipped to the United States each week.

title.children: These beekeepers created a new type of hive that's so popular they're shipping 500 to the US each week

image.altText: A man sings passionately into a with a drummer behind him playing.

props.synopsis: Changes to noise restrictions which will allow sounds of up to 75 decibels until 1am over the weekend in the city have been wholeheartedly embraced by the live music sector in Canberra.

title.children: 'Fun is not silent': Live entertainment noise limits in city relaxed significantly

image.altText: A sitting dog looks up at the camera.

props.synopsis: Oakley, the six-year-old border collie, is a conservation detection dog who sniffs out noxious alligator weed in Canberra's Lake Burley Griffin.

title.children: Conservation detection dog Oakley having a ball patrolling Lake Burley Griffin for invasive weed

image.altText: A prototype of a lunar rover, with big black wheels, a gold body and a panel on the side.

props.synopsis: An Australian-made rover called Roo-ver will be part of an upcoming NASA mission to the Moon to help extract oxygen and metals from lunar soil.

title.children: Could this prototype become Australia's first Moon rover?

image.altText: A middle aged woman shaking hands with a young school boy. Both are smiling

props.synopsis: The future of public schools will be decided in weeks. Will warring ministers miss the chance to fulfil the promise of the Gonski reforms?

title.children: Stakes high as time left to negotiate public school funding deal ticks down

image.altText: a young man smiling and holding a guitar

props.synopsis: Jetson's parents believe his death was one of the first overdoses to involve nitazene, which is increasingly being found in illicit drugs and counterfeit pharmaceuticals.

title.children: 'He didn't know the risks': Fake pharmaceuticals laced with a deadly synthetic opioid claim young man's life

image.altText: A crater surrounded by rubble is filled with people and an excavator in the ruins of a building

props.synopsis: More humanitarian "safe zones" have been ordered to evacuate as thousands are once again displaced in Gaza.

title.children: Hamas official dismisses ceasefire 'illusion' as Israeli strikes kill 25 across central Gaza and Lebanon

image.altText: A woman cupping roasted coffee beans in her hands.

props.synopsis: The Australian coffee industry is aiming to get bigger and better. Whether it can or not hinges on access to prime real estate and importing smaller coffee trees.

title.children: Inside the push to boost homegrown coffee in Australia

image.altText: Chen Zi Jun works on a laptop on a narrow timber desk inside her flat, with a streaming camera mounted nearby.

props.synopsis: China's strenuous workplace culture demands intense hours with little time for life, prompting many young people to escape the grind — often without another job lined up or any concrete future plans beyond leaving the rat race.

title.children: Chinese companies demand 'work-life integration'. Young people are 'naked quitting' instead

props.synopsis: Indira Naidoo reported on Timor-Leste for many years as a young journalist. On her first ever visit to the country, with President Ramos-Horta as her guide, Indira discovers the challenges the world's youngest democracy faces and what the future holds.

title.children: Indira Naidoo and the president on a Mini Moke adventure through the world's youngest democracy

image.altText: A huge neoclassical white building is shown with smoke rising behind it

props.synopsis: Authorities said more than 100 firefighters were responding to the blaze at the building that previously housed members of the royal family.

title.children: Flames and smoke billow from historic Somerset House in central London

image.altText: A group of people protesting. Two women are holding banners, with their fists raised in the air.

props.synopsis: More than 1 million doctors were expected to join the strike, protesting the brutal rape and murder of a female junior doctor in a Kolkata hospital.

title.children: Indian hospitals turn away patients as doctors protest rape and murder of a trainee doctor

image.altText: Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant

props.synopsis: The International Atomic Energy Agency warns safety at Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant in south-eastern Ukraine is deteriorating, after a recent drone strike outside its protection zone.

title.children: Nuclear danger heightens amid military attacks on Europe's largest power facility, IAEA warns

image.altText: Black Caviar

props.synopsis: Champion racehorse Black Caviar dies a day before her 18th birthday from a painful disease of the foot, as tributes start to flow for the Australian mare.

title.children: 'The ride of a lifetime': Racing industry mourns the death of champion racehorse Black Caviar

image.altText: A police car and an emergency vehicle surround a crushed car

props.synopsis: Young woman driver found guilty on two charges but jurors, forced to leave the court house when a fire alarm went off, were unable to reach consensus on a third charge.

title.children: Jury dismissed after it was unable to reach final verdict on fatal crash charges

image.altText: John Lyons Twitter

props.synopsis: The ABC's global affairs editor also received the awards for Outstanding Team Player or Mentor and Outstanding Feature Writing.

title.children: John Lyons named Journalist of the Year at 2024 Kennedy Awards

image.altText: Hard Quiz host Tom Gleeson smirks behind the podium. The Hard Quiz logo is in the top right corner

props.synopsis: Welcome back, I missed you! Just kidding, that never happens. Let's get on with it, it's time to play, HARD!

title.children: Reckon you could outsmart one of my contestants? Prove it

image.altText: A dingo walks across the sand wearing a large collar

props.synopsis: Rangers say dingoes were loitering near a large family group fishing off the beach moments before a girl was attacked by a male dog on K'gari.

title.children: Girl, 4, flown to hospital after dingo attack on K'gari beach

image.altText: A screenshot from the ABC News opening credits in the 1980s of a satellite hovering around earth

props.synopsis: This week, after a hiatus of 19 years, the old ABC TV News Theme will return to the 7pm bulletins with a fresh lick of paint.

title.children: The iconic ABC TV News Theme heralded the bulletin for almost two decades. Now it's making a comeback

image.altText: An Indonesian guy taking a photo with his rental girlfriend in a photobox.

props.synopsis: Imagine a service where you can hire someone to go on a romantic date, hold your hand during a movie, send flirty texts, and even stay on the phone with you until you drift off to sleep. Here is a look at the growing rent-a-partner industry in Indonesia.

title.children: 'Your dream partner': Inside the booming industry of rental girlfriends and boyfriends

image.altText: Justine Ghekiere celebrates winning Tour de France Femmes stage seven.

props.synopsis: Justine Ghekiere races away from a breakaway group to claim victory in the penultimate stage of the Tour de France Femmes, while Katarzyna Niewiadoma retains the leader's yellow jersey.

title.children: Belgian Ghekiere goes solo to win Tour de France Femmes stage seven

image.altText: Faded yellow old-style boogie board labelled "Nallah's Taxi" and with a smiley face, resting against esky/cooler box with rope

props.synopsis: The off-duty lifesaver used an old boogie board to save four young girls and their dads from treacherous surf.

title.children: How one woman saved six people with a dodgy boogie board

image.altText: Two men in suits grab each other violently at a lectern while others watch

props.synopsis: An opposition MP's labelling of the government as "terrorists" over the jailing of his fellow MP led to punches being thrown.

title.children: Fistfight breaks out between Turkish MPs in parliament

image.altText: Canberra Raiders NRL players sit on the sidelines during loss to North Queensland Cowboys.

props.synopsis: Canberra coach Ricky Stuart lets his feelings be known about the Raiders performance in Townsville, as the Cowboys score seven tries to one to consolidate their position inside the top eight.

title.children: Furious Stuart labels Raiders 'precious' after Cowboys dish out 42-4 thrashing

image.altText: Izak Rankine of the Crows knocked out by Dan Houston of the Power

props.synopsis: The Power's Dan Houston may miss the finals after his high bump on Izak Rankine left the Crows star concussed during Saturday night's Showdown at Adelaide Oval.

title.children: 'A really fair player': Power defend Houston as lengthy ban looms after brutal bump in Showdown win

image.altText: Lead singer of a band leaps into the air, while his band play on behind him

props.synopsis: Australian band The Cat Empire joins musicians objecting to the Melbourne Symphony Orchestra's cancellation of a performance by a pianist who spoke about the conflict in Gaza.

title.children: The Cat Empire postpones shows as musicians vote no confidence in MSO

image.altText: John Cena and Awkwafina look at something off camera

props.synopsis: The world of Jackpot!, where California civilians are encouraged to murder for lotto money, is only a touch more ridiculous than the script this action comedy tries to pull off.

title.children: Jackpot! doesn't live up to its government-sanctioned murder lotto concept

image.altText: Two rugby players hug each other after a try. One holding the ball after scoring is then embraced by his teammate

props.synopsis: South Africa secure a sweep of the Wallabies on Australian soil, scoring four tries to nil for a 30-12 win in wet conditions at Perth Stadium.

title.children: Springboks maul their way to 18-point win over Wallabies in Perth

image.altText: Fusilli pasta with meat bolognese tomato sauce in a plastic box container with a green lid.

props.synopsis: Have you ever tried to triple a recipe and have it go very wrong? Batch cooking can save time during the week, but not all recipes are suitable.

title.children: Why your batch cooking might be failing and how to fix it

image.altText: 13 planes flying in formation above beach

props.synopsis: Most days these amateur pilots work in IT, accounting and one even runs a cleaning business. This weekend they're sharing airspace with some of the world's most talented high-flyers, after convincing event organisers to let them take to the skies.

title.children: How these amateur pilots propelled their way into Gold Coast Airshow

image.altText: Strawberries growing

props.synopsis: Finding spoiled fruit in your fridge is frustrating but research is underway to make strawberries last longer.

title.children: Why your strawberries are unexpectedly rotting in your fridge

image.altText: A motorcycle that has been nearly destroyed on a main road behind police tape.

props.synopsis: Police allege the teen was behind the wheel of a stolen BMW that collided with a motorcycle in Preston last Sunday.

title.children: Teenager charged over hit-and-run death of motorcyclist in Melbourne's northern suburbs

image.altText: A white woman wears a pink dress, scarf and sunglasses and a curly blonde wig as she peers at the camera in a mid-shot.

props.synopsis: From your next exotic animal docuseries obsession to Jeff Goldblum as a god in KAOS, here are five series that are new, good and out this month.

title.children: The newest bizarre documentary from the makers of Tiger King is here — this time it's about chimps
